channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for FL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for FL

item.title: Report X-2023111152
item.description:
Report X-2023111152

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-04T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-16
  • City: JACKSONVILLE
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Wet box found during unload of trailer from preload. Box was placed in plastic bag and taken to damage cage. DescribePack: Small hole in cap. The inner seal of cap was missing. Causing liquid to leak out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: After inspection box and contents were placed in a hazmat bag and salvage drum.

item.title: Report X-2023110978
item.description:
Report X-2023110978

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-01T18:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-14
  • City: TAMPA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package arrived already wet to the station and it was placed in a hazmat bag and bin for further containment and inspection. DescribePack: All 4 plastic bottles leaked from loose caps. The 2 bottles of Rapicide Part A are hazardous but not the Part B. The caps were not secured. No padding was used. Only slotted partitions were used as inner packaging materials. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The wet package was placed in a hazmat bag and bin for further containment upon arrival. No release was found.

item.title: Report X-2023110970
item.description:
Report X-2023110970

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-01T18:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-14
  • City: OCALA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found wet. Upon inspection it was found that a 4.5 gallon pail of Hydrogen Peroxide, aqueous solution had a loose closure which caused leakage. DescribePack: a 4.5 gallon pail of Hydrogen Peroxide, aqueous solution had a loose closure which caused leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in a hazmat lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2023110755
item.description:
Report X-2023110755

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-01T18:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-03
  • City: FORT MYERS
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: While unloading the cardboard was noticed to be "soft" no visible wet spots. Further inspection was needed. DescribePack: 2 of 4 bottles of reagent alcohol had lids that were barely on the bottles. There is a measure in place on the lids that indicate if the bottles were opened. this was still in place as upon inspection when turning the lids can hear the tab "break" indicating that it was previously unopened. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: lids tightened and ensured the bottles in a bin were upright

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was found in the HazMat Cage inside a red tote and HazMat bag. Unknown who and when placed it there. DescribePack: The top and a side of the box was wet from within. One jug had a loose cap. The seal under the cap was off. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Someone had already moved it to the HazMat Cage within a red tote and HazMat bag for processing.

  • City: FORT PIERCE
  • State: FL

  • Carrier/Reporter: GREENWOOD MOTOR LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A spill was reported on the dock, pro 162042606. A nail on the pallet punctured a 15-G plastic drum of Laundry Built Detergent, pid# 6101844. (1) G released behind door 33. No drains, waterways, or environmental impact. The spill was contained and cleaned. All material was placed into an overpack for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023110309
item.description:
Report E-2023110309

  • Carrier/Reporter: GREENWOOD MOTOR LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A 55-G plastic drum was punctured in transit by another pallet due to unprotected freight no dunnage. Approximately 3c. of material was released. No drain, waterway or environmental impact. Material covered with floor dry, swept up and placed in appropriate containers. Proper PPE was used. All materials were placed into an overpack for proper disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023101441
item.description:
Report X-2023101441

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-04T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-24
  • City: GAINESVILLE
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: X-2023101441 AT THE GAINESVILLE FLORIDA UPS CUSTOMER COUNTER FACILITY, A CUSTOMER DROPPED OFF AN AIR PACKAGE DESTINED TO SPAIN. THE THERMAL TRACKING LABEL AND INVOICE DESCRIBE CONTENTS AS SODIUM POLYACRYLATE (25G). UPON INSPECTION OF PACKAGE CONTENTS THERE IS ONE BOTTLE OF 3-METHYLINDOLE (SKATOLE), >99% ACS GRADE, CAS: 83-34-1. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 3V5R01, YANNI MORAITES, 2838 NW 41ST AVE., GAINESVILLE FL 32605. X-2023101442-AT THE GAINESVILLE FLORIDA UPS CUSTOMER COUNTER FACILITY, A CUSTOMER DROPPED OFF A THREE DAY SELECT AIR PACKAGE DESTINED FOR NH, USA. UPON INSPECTION OF INNER CONTENTS DISCOVERED TWO REGULATED DANGEROUS GOODS CHEMICALS. ONE BOTTLE IS IODOMETHANE, CAS: 74-88-4 REGULATED AS UN2644, METHYL IODIDE, 6.1, PG I. ONE BOTTLE IS BROMOETHANE, CAS: 74-96-4 REGULATED AS UN1891, ETHYL BROMIDE, 3 (6.1),II. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 3V5R01, YANNI MORAITES, 2838 NW 41ST AVE., GAINESVILLE FL 32605.

item.title: Report X-2023110464
item.description:
Report X-2023110464

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-29T18:13:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-10
  • City: PUNTA GORDA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Around 530 a.m. 2023-10-10 a package handler stated that he had a damage hazmat box that was leaking. He placed it on the floor till the manager came and retrieved it. DescribePack: Upon opening the box, it was discovered that the caps of three of the bottles are loose. The leakage was very minimal, only about 4 oz in total. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The box was placed up-right, and the caps were tightened.

item.title: Report X-2023110167
item.description:
Report X-2023110167

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg. was received wet and compromised. Pkg. taken to QA for further inspection. DescribePack: Upon inspecting the contents, it was noted that both of the 1 gallon plastic containers had loose caps, causing about 2 oz. of liquid to leak from each. There were no materials inside to protect the containers. Orientation arrows were present on the box. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: Pkg. was placed inside a bin, awaiting instructions from PGH.

  • City: HIALEAH

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported the spill consisted of (1) 55 gallon metal drum of Lacolene (UN1268), which was delivered to the NMF terminal from another terminal missing approximately 20 gallons due to a puncture at the bottom, and was repalletized and sent over. The terminal attempted to move this drum and 2 others to the consignee, but all three were refused. The terminal stated they placed the one damaged drum into a 65 gallon poly drum, and the other two that were undamaged were shrink wrapped and placed on a pallet. Waste was left for terminal to manage.
